Sentencas: Commercial direct flame fuel cells (DFFC) need larger cell surface area for higher power output.
Titulo: Two-dimensional modeling for physical processes in direct flame fuel cells

Sentencas: In such cases, multi-dimensional effects play significant roles on cell performances.
Titulo: Two-dimensional modeling for physical processes in direct flame fuel cells

Sentencas: In this work, a two-dimensional numerical model is developed to illustrate physical behaviors associated with the multi-dimensional effects in DFFCs.
Titulo: Two-dimensional modeling for physical processes in direct flame fuel cells

Sentencas: It is revealed that DFFCs suffer from the negative consequences of non-uniform distributions of temperature, species and voltage in radial direction.
Titulo: Two-dimensional modeling for physical processes in direct flame fuel cells

Sentencas: Non-uniform distributions of temperature and species results in the decrease of current density at edge regions of DFFCs, owing to lower ionic conductivities and fuel species concentration.
Titulo: Two-dimensional modeling for physical processes in direct flame fuel cells

Sentencas: And the non-uniform voltage distribution in radial direction causes the decreases of current density at center regions of DFFCs due to the lower over-potential there.
Titulo: Two-dimensional modeling for physical processes in direct flame fuel cells

Sentencas: Therefore, current density distributions in electrolytes are likely to be M-shaped.
Titulo: Two-dimensional modeling for physical processes in direct flame fuel cells

Sentencas: The multi-dimensional effects become progressively important with increasing the size of solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Two-dimensional modeling for physical processes in direct flame fuel cells

Sentencas: Comparing with the DFFC with a SOFC with small cell radius (6.5 mm), a DFFC with a SOFC with large cell radius (33.75 mm) has 25-30% lower maximum power density.
Titulo: Two-dimensional modeling for physical processes in direct flame fuel cells

Sentencas: We also reveal that cross-over electronic currents in samaria-doped-ceria electrolytes and fuel species starvation due to the secondary oxidation are dominant factors on the cell performance loss at high cell temperatures (similar to 1000 K).
Titulo: Two-dimensional modeling for physical processes in direct flame fuel cells
